turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...The juice is climbin' every week.

turns.speaker: FATS
turns.text: I know the juice is climbin' -- I been workin' six months just to pay the damn interest.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya still light seventy.

turns.speaker: FATS
turns.text: Waits! -- Be smart. Ya don't have to break nothin' -- Here, take my coat, it's worth fifty-sixty dollars. It's yours.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: He only had a hundred an' thirty. -- I think he's good for the rest next week, Mr. Gazzo.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Sure, Rocky, Bob's good for it...

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Tomorrow collect from Del Rio -- He's late three weeks. How'd you do last night?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Fine.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Yo Rock. Did I give you a job this mornin? How come ya didn't break this guy's thumb like I asked ya? When ya don't do what ya are told, it makes me look bad, kid.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I figure if I break the thumb this guy gets thrown outta his job and can't pay nothin' no more.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: It don't matter. It's my reputation. These guys think they can get off light. It's bad for my reputation -- It's bad for business. See ya killer.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Next Wednesday I grab a grand from Snyder. An' Thursday two yards from Cappoli, okay?

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: No, two yards from Snyder, an' a grand from Cappoli.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya sure?

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Hey, screw ya brain on right. Now, who's this girl you're going out with tonight?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: How'd you know?

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: You think I don't hear things?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Paulie's sister.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Buddy's in a bad mood -- prostate problems.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: He's always in a bad mood.  Count ya blessin's. Ya a healthy person -- ya legs work -- ya hands work --

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Buddy's got a thing against ya, Rock. Some people just hate for no reason, y'know.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Here's fifty bucks -- You an' the girl have a nice time.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Thanks, Mr. Gazzo.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Y'know I won't be able to work for ya no more.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Hey -- if a good man can make a better life, let him make it.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I feel bad about walkin'.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Take your shot, kid -- You got money for trainin' expenses?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: A few bucks.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Here's five hundred -- Put it in your glove.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Do I have to pay juice?

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Does Santa Claus charge juice? Merry Christmas -- Now, how's about my present, ya gonna win?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Gonna try.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Listen, kid, I'm with ya. Ya know, I'm with ya -- Italian, we're blood. You kill this rug -- We Guinneas gotta show these Afro-Americans where it's at. Give it your best shot cause I want ya to prove to these bums on the corner that my man can't be beat by this rug... Ya got any action on the side.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: No action.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Ya gettin 150 grand killer. Ya got any plans for it? Whatta ya think? Ya like to put it on the street, make it work for ya?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I'm gonna do somethin with it.

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Sure, you do what ya want. Stay away from the stock market.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Black market?

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Same thing. Ya know, Rock, remember when we was kids, we fought together. An' I wasn't well an' ya had to beat up that Irish kid -- what's his name? -- Gallager -- I bought a suit and became a businessman. You put on gloves. An' I remember Mama almost cried, may she rest in peace -- an' our ol' man who said ya had no brains --I'd like to lay hands on that bastard. You ain't never had any luck. Even when I owned you in '66 you never had luck. But now I think you might be gettin' some luck kid. Whatta you think?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo, you gonna show, Tony?

turns.speaker: GAZZO
turns.text: Where else am I gonna go.  Bet three grand on Rocky.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Hello, Mr. Balboa -- I'm Miles Jergens -- Please, have a seat.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Thanks.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Mr. Balboa --

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Rocky.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Rocky, do you have any representation? A manager?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: No -- Just me.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Rocky, would you be interested in --

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Sparrin'?

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I know ya need sparrin' partners -- I'm very available.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: I'm sure you are.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Absolutely -- Sparrin' with the Champ would be an honor -- y'know what?

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I wouldn't take no cheap shots. I'd be a good sparrin' partner.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Rocky, would you be interested in fighting Apollo Creed for the Championship?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Like I said, I'd make a boss sparrin' mate.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Did you hear what I said?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Sure, an' I'm smart enough to know that no sparrin' partner should take cheap shots at the Champ. He's just there to help condition the man.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Not spar, I'm asking whether you would be interested in fighting Creed for the championship.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: ...Screw you.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: ...Screw you, yoyo.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Did these guys teach you to talk dirty? Huh?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Hey --

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Stuff it, man!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Don't you never say that --  -- You guys talk like that in front of a little girl -- You guys are scum.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: How come ya wanna hang out with those guys? They teach ya bad things.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I like 'em. If you don't you can f --

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Hey! When I was your age, there was only one girl who talked like that in the whole neighborhood.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: ...Yeah.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Make your teeth yella --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I like yella teeth.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Makes your breath like garbage.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Maybe I like garbage.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Nobody likes garbage -- Anyway, this girl with the dirty mouth wasn't bad lookin', but the guys wouldn't take her out for any serious datin'.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: 'Cause that's the way guys are -- They laugh when ya talk dirty. They think ya cute for a while, but then ya getta reputation an' watch out. Nobody's ever gonna take ya serious. Ya get no respect... I gotta use a bad word -- Whore. You'll end up maybe becomin' a whore.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: C'mon, Rocky. I'm twelve.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: That doesn't matter -- You don't really have to be a whore, just act like one an' that's it.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo, a bad reputation -- Twenty years from now people will say 'D'you remember Marie?' 'No, who was she?' 'She was that little whore who hung out at the Atomic Hoagie Shop.' 'Oh, now I remember!'... See, they don't remember you, they remember the rep.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Listen, I hope ya don't --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I won't.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What was I gonna say?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Ya hope I don't keep acting like a whore or I'll turn into one, right?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya, somethin' like that.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Goodnight, Rocky.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: 'Night, Marie.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I don't care what nobody says, this bum Creed woulda never made it in the Thirties --

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Hey, how ya feelin', Mickey?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...What?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I said, how ya feelin'?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Do you see me talkin'? Huh?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Then stand there an' wait till I'm done -- Creed's good, yeah, he's real fine but I gotta boy, y'know Big Dipper, who's got the stuff it takes to be a champ -- He's mean, quick, an' big -- What more d'ya need? Okay, go to work...  Hey -- Yeah -- Whatta ya want?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I was talkin' with ya man, Mike. -- Hey, how come I been put outta my locker?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Dipper needed it.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Dipper's a climber -- You're a tomato.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Tomato?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Facts is facts. I run a business here -- I'm cleanin' house --

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: How old are ya?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...What?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: How old?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Come July, twenty-five.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: More like thirty.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Twenty-five, thirty -- What's the difference? -- It took me two months to learn the combination of that locker.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: The legs must be goin'.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah, they're goin', -- that's nature... That was my locker for six years.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...Did ya fight last night?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah --

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Did ya win?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah, Kayo.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...Who'd ya fight?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Spider Rice.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Rice is a bum.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: You think everybody I fight is a bum.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Ain't they?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Ya want the truth -- Ya got heart, but ya fight like an ape -- The only thing special about you is ya never got ya nose broke -- keep ya nose pretty -- what's left of ya brain an' retire.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Listen, I'm gonna take a steam -- Did good last night -- Shoulda seen it.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Hey, ever think about retirin'?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Think about it.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Did ya get the message, kid?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Message -- What message?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: A Rep from Miles Jergens' Promotions was lookin' for ya -- They need sparrin' partners for Creed.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya puttin' me on?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Here's the card?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: When was they here?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: 'Bout an hour ago.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Probably lookin' for sparrin' partners.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...I said that before.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I seen the light. I figure somebody was home.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Hey, Mickey -- Whatta ya doin' here? Here, sit down.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Best seat in the house -- Hey, Mick, this is too much.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: How do you mean?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I'm usta seein' ya at the gym, but seein' ya here, in my house, it's kinda outta joint.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Listen, Rock, you're a very lucky guy.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What's happened is freak luck.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Freak luck for sure.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Look at all them other fighters. Real good boys. Good records. Colorful. Fight their hearts out for peanuts -- But who cared? Nobody. They got it shoved in their back door. Nobody ever give them a shot at the title...

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Freak luck is a strange thing.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Whatta' those?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Turtles -- domestic turtles.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I'm here tellin' ya to be very smart with this shot. Like the Bible sez, ya don't get no second chance.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Fifty years, huh.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Fifty years. The rep is known around Philly, an' a good rep can't be bought, but I don't have to tell you that.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: How 'bout a glass of water?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Rocky, d'ya know what I done?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...What?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I done it all. I've done an' seen everything'. Believe what I'm tellin' ya -- Ya shoulda seen the night in Brooklyn, I smacked 'Ginny' Russo outta the ring, September 14, 1923 -- same night Firpo knocked Dempsey outta the ring. But who got the Press? He did. He had a manager -- September 14, 1923.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya got a good mind for dates.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Nobody ever said that -- There's his picture.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah, ya kinda remind me of the Rock. Ya move like 'im.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Really think so?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Ya got heart.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Heart, but I ain't got no Tocker.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Respect, I always dished ya respect.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Ya gave Dipper my locker.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I'm sorry, I -- I made a mistake. Kid, I'm askin' man to man. I wanna be ya manager.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: The fight's set -- I don't need a manager.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Look, you can't buy what I know. Ya can't. I've seen it all! I got pain an' I got experience.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I got pain an' experience too.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Please, kid.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Whatever I got, I always got on the slide. This shot's no different. I didn't earn nothin' -- I got it on the slide... I needed ya help about ten years ago when I was startin', but ya never helped me none.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: If ya was wantin' my help, why didn't ya ask? Just ask.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I asked, but ya never helped nothin'! -- Like the Bible sez, ya don't get no second chance.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Rocky, I'm seventy-six years old. Maybe you can be the winner I never was -- your shot is my last shot!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Tie it to both ankles -- Leave two feet slack.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I never had good footwork.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What cha say, Benny -- Meet 'The Rock.' This is our cutman, Benny Stein.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo, Benny.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Check the eyes, Ben.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Don't you care what the people will say?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...I'm doin' it for a friend.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Whatta you get outta this?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I get the robe an' Paulie gets three grand.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...Shrewd.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Don't let 'im get you tight.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Whatta ya think that outfit cost?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: God bless ya, Rock.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Thanks, Mick -- I'm gonna try.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: How am I doin'?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Real good.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: See how fast he is -- damn!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Breathe deep -- Keep ya chin down!! Use the legs and drive through 'im. Attack -- Attack -- Attack!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Ya nose is broke.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Damn! How's it look?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Can't hardly tell. Don't swallow the blood -- Go for his ribs. Don't let 'im breathe.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...The guy's great.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Why don't ya tell 'im you're a fan!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: How you holdin' up, kid?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Fine... That guy's great.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Gimme the water! Ya gettin' tagged with his right. I think you should feint left and high hook 'im -- Benny, check the eyes! Can ya see?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: See what?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Wanna keep goin'?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Would you keep goin'?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...Yeah.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: How I look out there, Mick?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Great, kid, great.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I don't care what they say, you're a winner.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo, can I have my locker back?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo, Mike -- What's happenin' here?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It ain't your locker no more.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Whatta ya talkin' about it ain't my locker no more?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Listen, I'm with you -- But ya gotta talk to Mickey -- I put ya stuff in the bag over there.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: You were ready to bite that guy's face.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah -- See the fight last night? Apollo Creed beat that English guy bad.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Creed's great.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey, Rock -- What happened?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: 'Bout what?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Ya sappin' his strength -- He's losin' steam.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: He ain't losin' nothin'.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No more, ya wanna lose an eye? No more.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Open my eyes -- Please, open my eyes!

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Startin' with the bad jokes early today, huh.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Inventin' jokes ain't easy.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: How's Butkus this mornin'?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Ain't had time to check 'em.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...What kinda dog is this again?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Bullmastiff.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: The owner was suppose to pick him up three weeks ago.

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: We're not responsible for animals left over thirty days -- We board it ain't a animal shelter, Y'know... Adrian, I want you to clean all those cat cages downstairs, they're a mess.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo, Paulie.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Yo, Rocky -- Look at this mirror. I'd like to kill the friggin' moron who broke this mirror.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo, Paulie.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Your sister's givin' me the shoulder.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Forget her. You could do better than my sister.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Every mornin', every night I pass by -- I smile. I say jokes. Nothin'. She looks at me.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Looks, huh?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah, like I was a plate of leftovers -- Somethin' wrong with my face -- Whatta I need, a Caddy to connect with ya sister?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: My sister's a friggin' loser.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Hey --

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Sometimes she gets me so crazy, I'd like to split her head with a razor.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Don't get mental, man.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Ya caught me in a bad mood.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya always in a bad mood --

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: ...Adrian ain't sharp.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: She's a loser -- She don't enjoy life -- She reads -- Brainy -- Pushin' thirty friggin' years old!  She's gonna die alone if she don't wise up.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I'm thirty myself.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: An' you're dyin' alone, too.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I don't see no crowd around you, neither.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: I wanna kill the friggin' moron who broke the mirror.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Let's get outta this stink.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: The girl's dryin' up! She's gotta live a little before her body dries up!! You're a pal, Rock -- How 'bout yo' talk to her? Y'know, it's Thanksgivin' tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Sure.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Tomorrow you come for some bird, right?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Absolutely...

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I usta be deadly at half-ball.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: I hate the friggin' game... I'd like to talk some business.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What kinda business?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Look at my hands -- See how the joints are swollen.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Inflamed joints -- Walkin' in an' out of a freezer carryin' meat plays hell on the joints.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Maybe ya should see a doctor.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: I don't need a doctor, I need a different job.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Maybe another job is the best thing.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Do me a favor -- Talk to Gazzo. Tell him I'm a friend an' would do a good job... Tell him I ain't bothered by nothin' an' would be a great collector... Bustin' bones don't bother me -- Tell him I'm a good worker.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Gazzo's gotta come to you.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: I'm askin' ya to go to him -- As a favor.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Gazzo's gotta come to you -- Hey, Paulie, it's a bad job -- Do what you do now.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya sister knows I'm comin'?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Yeah, sure -- She's very excited.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: !! Ya want the bird, go out in the alley an' eat the bird -- I want ya outta the house -- Enjoy ya friggin' life... Ya hungry, Rock?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Maybe ya better forget it.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Forget nothin' -- Here, talk to my sister, tell 'er somethin' nice.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Maybe I better forget it.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Try again, c'mon, try again.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What's ya sister like to do?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Ice skate.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I didn't want no turkey anyway.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Don't it matter none he's makin' ya out a fool? -- I'd break his lips.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: It don't matter.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: He's takin' cheap shots.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: It don't bother me none.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Yo, Rock -- now ya'll be lookin' for people to help, right?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Help what?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Y'know, to help keep ya livin' clean.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I'll do okay.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Ya gotta have a guy help ya exercise, mebbe somebody to be standin' by with a towel or run errands, y'know.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Hey, who cared about me yesterday, huh? Nobody -- I think I'm gonna train myself.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Without havin' good people around, ya won't have such a good chance.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: How ya feelin'?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Tight.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: I got whiskey here.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: If ya don't pay Gazzo, ya end up hangin' on the hook, right?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Gazzo's a good man.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: How 'bout you talk to 'em about me?  Please do me that favor.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Keep this job, ya eat better.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Y'know, d'ya think you an' my sister -- Ah, doin' good together?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Whatta you think?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Ain't sure, what's the story?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: The story -- what's happenin'?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Ya really like her?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Sure I like her.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: What's the attraction? I don't see it?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I dunno -- she fills gaps.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: What gaps?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: She got gaps. I got gaps -- together we fill the gaps.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: You ballin' her?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Don't talk dirty 'bout ya sister.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: C'mon, ya screwin' her?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Yo, Rock. I made a few phone calls an' thanks to me ya goin' to be a big man -- Thatta dog?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Whatta these guys want?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: To see ya train.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo, what's with you? -- It was suppose to be private.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: I thought I was doin' ya a favor -- C'mon inside -- Y'know, my sister really likes ya.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Outta my house I want ya!!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...It's cold outside, Paulie.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: ...I can't haul meat no more.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What can I do about it?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Christ, I been beggin' ya for a break until I'm sick inside.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What break? Huh? What break! Who am I to give breaks! I'm a fighter, you haul meat. You do what you do an' I do what I do best -- that's it -- that's life, man!

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: So much has happened lately -- Has it changed your life style much?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...People talk to me more.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: How're you preparing for this Bicentennial bout?

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: We can cut that out later. Apollo Creed says he'll let you stay three rounds before he puts you away.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Apollo's a great fighter.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: Do you feel you have a chance?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Maybe --

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I'll tear his head off.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: Do you have anything derogatory to say about the Champion?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Derogatory? Yeah, he's great.

turns.speaker: REPORTER #2
turns.text: This is your largest payday ever -- How do you feel about it?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Feel? I dunno... Happy.

turns.speaker: REPORTER #2
turns.text: How will you fight Apollo Creed?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Creed's great, ain't he... I'll do what I can.

turns.speaker: REPORTER #2
turns.text: Is it true the most you've ever made in a prizefight is five hundred dollars?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Four hundred -- But that was a long time ago.

turns.speaker: REPORTER #2
turns.text: And now your payday will be one hundred and fifty thousand dollars. Any comment?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Listen, I wanna say hi to my girlfriend -- Yo, Adrian!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: We don't serve formula. Snookums.

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: You serve martinis, doncha?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Oh, a ladies man, huh?

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: My problem is I got a fifty-year-old lust and a three-year-old dinkie.

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: No.  But neither does Roger.  That's Diablo Red.  Roger's pants are Sunrise Orange.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Well, I'll be...

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: So what's your next move, Valiant?

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: Make it dry.  Baby doesn't like to be wet.  You're Valiant, right?  The name's Baby Herman.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I know who you are.  Kinda out of your neighborhood, aren't you?

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: Yeah, I had to go slummin'.  See, a friend of mine's bein' framed.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You mean the rabbit?  They got him cold.

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: You don't believe that.  I mean. the guy's an idiot, a moron, a complete fool...  but he'd never kill anyone. I know the guy.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: My problem is I come here to drink in peace.  So if you don't mind...

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: C'mon, Valiant, doesn't this whole thing smell a bit funny to you?  I mean, no offense, but how did a mucky-muck like R.K. Maroon find you in the first place?

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: And another thing, the paper said no will was found.  But every Toon knows Acme had a will and, in it he promised to leave Toontown to the Toons.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: So where is it then?

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: Somebody took it from him.  That's what this whole thing's about.

turns.speaker: BABY HERMAN
turns.text: My hunch is it was Maroon.  He always was after Acme's property.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah?  Does he wear pants this color?

turns.speaker: BETTY BOOP
turns.text: Gee, it's swell to see you, Eddie.  We miss you in Toontown.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Wish I could say the same.  What're you doin' here, Betty?

turns.speaker: BETTY BOOP
turns.text: Work's been slow for me since the cartoons went to color.  But I still got it, Eddie...  'Boop boop be-doop'.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah, you still got it, Betty.  Who's Mr. Jocularity?

turns.speaker: BETTY BOOP
turns.text: That's Marvin Acme, the gag king.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Shoulda guessed.

turns.speaker: BETTY BOOP
turns.text: He comes here every night to see Jessica Rabbit.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Big on the musical comedy, huh?

turns.speaker: BETTY BOOP
turns.text: Sounds like you ve never seen her, Eddie.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR
turns.text: What's this, Roger?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: A tweeting bird?

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR
turns.text: That's right, a tweeting bird.  But what does the script say?  'Rabbit gets conked.  Rabbit sees <u>stars</u>!'  Not birds, stars!

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Please, Raoul.  I can give you stars, I know I can.  Just drop the safe on my head one more time.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR
turns.text: I've already dropped it on you twenty-three times.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Don't worry about me.  I can take it.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR
turns.text: I'm not worried about you.  I'm worried about the safe.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: So, makin' dame jokes, huh, Eddie? Well, lemme remind ya pal, it was a <u>dame</u> who took a hundred bucks out of the till so your landlord would't throw you out of your dump.  And it was a <u>dame</u> who trusted you for the money when no one else in town would.  And it's a <u>dame</u> who's tired of waitin' for you to straighten yourself out and get a job!

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Would this be the same dame who's going to feel awfully foolish when she finds out I've got her money.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: This is fifty bucks.  I need seventy-five before they check the books tomorrow.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You'll have it in the morning.  Now be a sport and lemme have twenty bucks to put in my pocket.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Is this paper even good?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Check the scrawl.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: R.K. Maroon.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Hey, Eddie, looks like you really stepped in it this time.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What are you complaining about?  Here's your fifty bucks.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: A new outfit bought the Red Car.  Some big company called Cloverleaf Industries.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: No kiddin'?  Bought the Red Cars, huh?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Bastards put him on notice.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Do you think the rabbit did it?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I don't wanna think.  I wanna drink.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Yeah, Eddie, it's not like you got an ad in the Yellow Pages.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Thanks for the vote of confidence.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: The papers said the safe door was opened, Eddie.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Stick to stuffin' the olives, willya, Dolores?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: So you're not even gonna bother to find out if the rabbit's gettin' framed?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: He's a Toon... who cares?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Jesus, Eddie, is this who I think it is?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Dolores, meet Roger Rabbit.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: He's a riot.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Oh, yeah?  Well, you're not handcuffed to him.  Anybody in the back room?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: It's all yours.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: So you decided to help him after all?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I oughta have my head examined.  Will you hold still?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Can you get him out of it, Eddie?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: If I can find whoever wanted to kill Acme bad enough to get this.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: So what's the scam, Eddie?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Maybe Baby Herman was right.  Somebody wants Acme's property.  Cack the old man, pin it on Roger, and destroy the will.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Maybe they just took it out of his pocket.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Then why'd they bother to crack the safe?  You can drop a Mosler 90 from Mount Baldy and it won't open.
